intro: Anisonema multiflorum, commonly known as the many-flowered anisonema, is a herbaceous plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Araliaceae and is characterized by its compound leaves with opposite arrangement. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers arranged in umbellate clusters, which are typical of its family. Its root system is often used in traditional medicine for its purported health benefits. Anisonema multiflorum thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories.
